dt: {bc}a position or site occupied or available for occupancy or marked by some distinguishing feature {bc}{sx|situation||}

dt.t: Much of the charm of the house is in its {wi}location{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a tract of land designated for a purpose
{bc}a place outside a motion-picture studio where a picture or part of it is filmed
usually used in the phrase {it}on location{/it}

dt.t: Parts of the movie were filmed on {wi}location{/wi} in the desert.
Fog made the {wi}location{/wi} of the harbor difficult.

dt: {bc}the placement of baseball pitches in a particular area of the strike zone
{bc}the ability to control the placement of pitches

shortdef: a position or site occupied or available for occupancy or marked by some distinguishing feature : situation
a tract of land designated for a purpose

dt: {bc}to locate (two or more things) together or be located together: such as
{bc}to cause (two or more things) to be in the same place or close together

dt.t: They [fog signals] are usually {wi}co-located{/wi} with another form of aid such as a light …
These rings almost certainly have their origin in the release of dust from each of the four small satellites … which are {wi}colocated{/wi} with the rings.

dt: {bc}to place (two or more units) close together so as to share common facilities

dt.t: Staying with the relaxation theme, it will make sense to {wi}co-locate{/wi} entertainment facilities, so your family and friends can occupy themselves during the training.

dt: {bc}to place (computer servers) together in a secure dedicated storage facility

dt.t: It has thousands of customers who pay handsomely to {wi}colocate{/wi} servers in carrier-neutral data centers that are network and cloud interconnection hubs.
… announced May 18 that the Oregon School for the Blind and the Oregon School for the Deaf would {wi}co-locate{/wi} on the OSD campus in Salem after the 2008-09 school year …

utxt.t: At our meeting in a construction trailer at the site in North Carolina's rural Rutherford County, Furlong tells me that in Facebook's early years it could get away with {wi}colocation{/wi} (where one building houses servers for several companies) and then, as the company grew, with leasing entire data centers.

shortdef: to locate (two or more things) together or be located together: such as
to cause (two or more things) to be in the same place or close together
to place (two or more units) close together so as to share common facilities
